summary: Email correspondence between an Assistant United States Attorney (AUSA) from the Southern District of New York and an FBI agent regarding the Jeffrey Epstein case. The AUSA requests contact information for an FBI forfeiture point of contact and asks if FinCEN checks (SARs/CTRs) have been run on Epstein. The FBI agent responds that they will provide the information and that an analyst is preparing a workup including SARs.

persons.name: Assistant United States Attorney Southern District of New York
persons.context: The sender of the initial email, requesting contact for FBI forfeiture issues and asking about FinCEN checks on Jeffrey Epstein.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: Referred to as the subject for whom FinCEN checks (SARs/CTRs) are being requested by the AUSA.

connections.person1: Assistant United States Attorney Southern District of New York
connections.description: The AUSA is investigating Epstein, as evidenced by the request for forfeiture contact and FinCEN checks.

events.title: Email Exchange on Forfeiture and FinCEN Checks
events.description: An AUSA from SDNY emails an FBI agent to request contact for forfeiture issues related to the Epstein case and to inquire if FinCEN checks (SARs/CTRs) have been run on Epstein. The FBI agent responds that they will look into the forfeiture contact and that an analyst is preparing a workup including SARs.
personsInvolved: Assistant United States Attorney Southern District of New York

keyFacts: The U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York was actively preparing for forfeiture-related issues in the Epstein case as of June 2019.
The prosecution team was seeking to identify and contact the FBI's point of contact for forfeiture matters.

The prosecution inquired about whether Financial Crimes Enforcement Network (FinCEN) checks, specifically Suspicious Activity Reports (SARs) and Currency Transaction Reports (CTRs), had been filed on Jeffrey Epstein.
The FBI confirmed that an analyst was preparing a financial workup on Epstein that would include SARs.
